examples: You're so anxious to keep your children out of harm's way that you're going to end up denying them a lot of valuable life experiences.
I used to get really anxious about the future, but then I started reminding myself that every day brings its bread.
I think we all have been sitting on pins and needles and anxious for something to happen.
Sarah was always striving for more success and recognition at work, but she found herself constantly stressed and anxious.
Sarah tends to dwell on her mistakes, which makes her feel anxious and insecure.
words.defineEn: feeling nervous or worried because of thinking something unpleasant might happen
words.defineVi: cảm thấy lo lắng hoặc lo lắng vì nghĩ rằng điều gì đó khó chịu có thể xảy ra

words.defineEn: irritable as if suffering from indigestion
words.defineVi: cáu kỉnh như thể bị khó tiêu

examples: But the trickster Loki concocted a devious plan.
And, as we see, people are turning to devious means to try to get in.
But, since direct confrontation can be risky, they’ve learned a more devious strategy: they lie.
That’s what allows devious royals to construct slopes that look deceptively similar.
Some of these nudibranchs have found a devious way to defend themselves, by stealing weapons from someone else.
words.defineEn: using crafty and clever methods to achieve goals or avoid negative consequences
words.defineVi: sử dụng các phương pháp xảo quyệt và thông minh để đạt được mục tiêu hoặc tránh hậu quả tiêu cực

examples: He was known in his time for his generosity and pious life.
words.defineEn: having strong faith in a religion and living according to it
words.defineVi: có niềm tin mãnh liệt vào một tôn giáo và sống theo nó

words.defineEn: marked by rude or peremptory shortness
words.defineVi: được đánh dấu bằng sự ngắn gọn thô lỗ hoặc hấp tấp

examples: The man-horse chimaera appear as a singular, grotesque body.
Well, he's a grotesque puppet.
Stories like this one from The Scottish antiquary, or, Northern notes and queries in 1891 speak to his terror of freshwater and the Nuckelavee’s grotesque appearance.
Ducks, rabbits, chickens, pigs, and yes goats, were all said to have been killed by a grotesque creature.
But the worst thing is that we have become really kind of a grotesque caricature of what the Republican Party has traditionally been.
words.defineEn: very ugly in a strange or funny way
words.defineVi: rất xấu xí theo một cách kỳ lạ hoặc buồn cười

words.defineEn: connected with a literary work or motion picture that deals with the adventures of a protagonist who is likable but has low morals
words.defineVi: liên quan đến một tác phẩm văn học hoặc phim điện ảnh đề cập đến cuộc phiêu lưu của một nhân vật chính đáng yêu nhưng có đạo đức thấp

examples: I feel nothing but pity for someone who holds such chauvinistic views.
Some people, called Deists, argued that God existed but that he didn’t influence everyday life after having set the machine of the universe in motion.
And some founders, like Jefferson, were Deists, believing that God had created the world, but then stepped away to, like, create other universes or try to build a boulder too big for him to lift.
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến chủ nghĩa thần thánh

examples: Even futurist, Elon Musk, seems to be hesitant about the idea of flying vehicles.
How does the futurist not see his own future?
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến chủ nghĩa vị lai

examples: While the eurypterines were busy competing with fish, stylonurines moved inland, to brackish and freshwater ecosystems where there were fewer placoderms and less competition.
They live in the estuaries of Southeast Asia, where mangrove trees stand knee deep in brackish water.
You can get it from oysters or from swimming with an open wound in brackish water where the bacteria lives.
And this warm, kinda brackish water turned out to be a great place for sea turtles, hosting an explosion of their diversity - including some of the giants.
We don't want to lose sight of other sorts of desal, brackish water, which is, you can think of brackish water is it's not as salty as ocean water, but it's saltier than freshwater.
words.defineEn: distasteful and unpleasant; spoiled by mixture
words.defineVi: khó chịu và khó chịu; hư hỏng bởi hỗn hợp

examples: Russia-backed separatists have been fighting against Ukrainian forces since 2014.
Russian-backed separatists and Ukrainian troops have been clashing in the Donbass region.
He wanted to punish the separatists.
AMNA NAWAZ: Russia-backed separatists have been fighting against Ukrainian forces since 2014.
And he wanted to punish the separatists.
words.defineEn: having separated or advocating separation from another entity or policy or attitude
words.defineVi: đã tách biệt hoặc ủng hộ việc tách biệt khỏi một thực thể hoặc chính sách hoặc thái độ khác
có khuynh hướng xấu; cáu kỉnh

examples: Though I suppose Trump's bread and butter is putting up garish eyesores.
These are available in white and gray and nord blue, which I think looks pretty garish.
That’s a garish, systemic damage to the system.
words.defineEn: too bright and colorful in a way that is tasteless
words.defineVi: quá sáng và đầy màu sắc theo cách vô vị

words.defineEn: not acknowledging the God of Christianity and Judaism and Islam
words.defineVi: không thừa nhận Thiên Chúa của Kitô giáo và Do Thái giáo và Hồi giáo
cảm xúc mãnh liệt hoặc không chân thành
dễ bị kích thích hoặc khó chịu

words.defineEn: marked by up-to-dateness in dress and manners
words.defineVi: được đánh dấu bởi sự cập nhật trong trang phục và cách cư xử
